title: Inserting Images and Lists in Web Pages - Multiple Choice Questions
subtitle: NIOS Class 12 Computer Science - Lesson 25

questions.question: Which image file format is best for photographs with lots of colors?
questions.explanation: JPG file format is the best option for images with lots of colors such as photographs. Their file size is also small and can be further reduced.

questions.question: Which image file format is best for images with few colors like logos?
questions.explanation: GIF file format is the best option for images with a few colors such as logos, pencil drawings, etc. Many small animations are also available as GIF files.

questions.question: Which image file format is best for images with transparency effects?
questions.explanation: PNG file format is the best option for images with transparency effects. PNG also supports lossless reduction in file size.

questions.question: Which tag is used to insert an image in a web page?
questions.explanation: tag is used to insert an image in a web page. It is an empty element that doesn't require a closing tag.

questions.question: Which attribute of tag is mandatory?
questions.explanation: SRC attribute is mandatory for tag. It specifies the URL (location + filename) of the image to be inserted.

questions.question: The SRC attribute of tag specifies:
questions.explanation: SRC attribute specifies the URL (Location + FileName) of the image. If image is in same folder as web page, only filename is needed.

questions.question: HEIGHT and WIDTH attributes of tag specify values in:
questions.explanation: HEIGHT and WIDTH attributes specify the display size of the image in pixels. If not specified, image displays in original size.

questions.question: BORDER attribute of tag specifies:
questions.explanation: BORDER attribute specifies the width/thickness of the image border in pixels. If not specified, image displays without border.

questions.question: ALT attribute of tag is used to:
options: Specify alternate text if image cannot be displayed
questions.explanation: ALT attribute specifies alternate text to be displayed if the image is not available or cannot be displayed, helping users understand what should be there.

questions.question: ALIGN="LEFT" in tag will:
options: Place image at left edge and wrap text around right side
Align image to left margin only
questions.explanation: ALIGN="LEFT" places the image at the left-most possible space and wraps other content around the right-hand side of the image.

questions.question: ALIGN="TOP" in tag will:
options: Place image at top of page
Align top of image with top of current line
questions.explanation: ALIGN="TOP" aligns the top of the image with the top of the current line of text.

questions.question: How many types of lists can be created in HTML?
questions.explanation: HTML provides three types of lists: Unordered (bulleted) lists, Ordered (numbered) lists, and Definition lists.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create an unordered list?
questions.explanation: <UL> tag is used to create an unordered (bulleted) list. Items are added using <LI> tags.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create an ordered list?
questions.explanation: <OL> tag is used to create an ordered (numbered) list where elements are given sequence numbers.

questions.question: Which tag is used to insert items in ordered and unordered lists?
questions.explanation: <LI> tag is used to insert items in both ordered and unordered lists. Each <LI> represents one list item.

questions.question: In an unordered list, the default bullet type is:
questions.explanation: The default bullet type in unordered lists is DISC (filled circle). This can be changed using TYPE attribute.

questions.question: TYPE="SQUARE" in <UL> tag will create bullets shaped like:
questions.explanation: TYPE="SQUARE" creates filled square (■) bullets in unordered lists.

questions.question: In an ordered list, the default numbering type is:
questions.explanation: The default numbering type in ordered lists is 1, 2, 3... (Arabic numerals). This can be changed using TYPE attribute.

questions.question: TYPE="I" in <OL> tag will create numbering like:
questions.explanation: TYPE="I" creates uppercase Roman numerals (I, II, III, IV, V...) for ordered list numbering.

questions.question: START attribute of <OL> tag is used to:
questions.explanation: START attribute specifies the starting number for ordered lists. For example, START=4 will begin numbering from 4.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create a definition list?
questions.explanation: <DL> tag is used to create definition lists, which contain terms and their definitions.

questions.question: In a definition list, terms to be defined are specified using:
questions.explanation: <DT> tag is used to specify terms to be defined in a definition list.

questions.question: In a definition list, definitions are specified using:
questions.explanation: <DD> tag is used to specify the definitions/descriptions corresponding to terms in a definition list.

questions.question: Lists can be nested in HTML:
questions.explanation: In HTML, lists can be nested into one another up to any level. Any type of list can be nested within any other type.

questions.question: In nested lists, which statement is true?
options: Only same types can be nested
Only ordered lists can contain unordered lists
Any type of list can be nested in any other type
questions.explanation: Any type of list (ordered, unordered, definition) can be nested within any other type of list in HTML.

questions.question: What happens if WIDTH and HEIGHT are not specified in tag?
questions.explanation: If HEIGHT and WIDTH attributes are not specified, the image will be displayed in its original size.

questions.question: If an image file is not found, what typically appears?
options: Cross symbol or broken image icon
questions.explanation: When an image cannot be found or displayed, browsers typically show a cross symbol or broken image icon in place of the image.

questions.question: ALIGN="MIDDLE" in tag will:
options: Align middle of image with baseline of current line
Place image in middle of text
questions.explanation: ALIGN="MIDDLE" aligns the middle of the image with the baseline of the current line of text.

questions.question: In the path "images\photo.jpg", the image is located in:
questions.explanation: The path "images\photo.jpg" indicates the image file is in a subfolder named 'images' within the current directory.

questions.question: TYPE="a" in <OL> tag creates numbering like:
questions.explanation: TYPE="a" creates lowercase alphabetic numbering (a, b, c, d...) in ordered lists.

questions.question: If you want to start an ordered list from number 5, you would use:
questions.explanation: START=5 attribute in <OL> tag will begin the ordered list numbering from 5 instead of 1.

questions.question: The START attribute takes what type of value?
questions.explanation: START attribute takes integer values only, regardless of the TYPE attribute setting (numbers, letters, or Roman numerals).

questions.question: TYPE="CIRCLE" in <UL> tag creates:
questions.explanation: TYPE="CIRCLE" creates empty circle (○) bullets in unordered lists.

questions.question: Images and lists can be combined in HTML:
questions.explanation: Images can be inserted within any type of list (ordered, unordered, or definition) along with text content.

questions.question: For best web page performance, image file sizes should be:
questions.explanation: For best web page performance and faster loading, image file sizes should be optimized to be as small as possible while maintaining acceptable quality.

questions.question: Which image format supports animations?
questions.explanation: GIF format supports animations. Many small animations are available in GIF format for web pages.

questions.question: ALIGN="RIGHT" in tag will:
options: Place image at right edge only
Place image at right edge and wrap content around left side
questions.explanation: ALIGN="RIGHT" places the image to the right-most possible space in the window and wraps content around the left side.

questions.question: The tag is:
questions.explanation: is an empty element that doesn't have a corresponding closing tag. It stands alone.

questions.question: In nested lists, proper tag closing order is:
questions.explanation: In nested lists, tags should be closed in reverse order - the last tag opened should be the first tag closed.

questions.question: Definition lists are most suitable for:
questions.explanation: Definition lists are most suitable for glossaries, dictionaries, and any content where terms need to be defined or explained.

questions.question: When an image is larger than specified HEIGHT and WIDTH:
questions.explanation: When HEIGHT and WIDTH are specified, the image gets resized (scaled) to fit those dimensions, regardless of original size.

questions.question: ALIGN="BOTTOM" in tag will:
options: Place image at bottom of page
Align bottom of image with baseline of current line
questions.explanation: ALIGN="BOTTOM" aligns the bottom of the image with the baseline of the current line of text.

questions.question: Which is NOT a valid value for TYPE attribute in <UL> tag?
questions.explanation: TRIANGLE is not a valid value for TYPE attribute in <UL>. Valid values are DISC, CIRCLE, and SQUARE only.

questions.question: A complete image tag with all basic attributes would look like:
questions.explanation: A complete image tag includes SRC (mandatory), HEIGHT, WIDTH for sizing, and ALT for accessibility and fallback text.

questions.question: Lists are commonly used in web pages for:
options: Navigation, content organization, and structured information
questions.explanation: Lists are versatile and commonly used for navigation menus, organizing content, creating bullet points, and presenting structured information.

questions.question: The best way to judge image suitability for web pages is:
questions.explanation: The best way to judge image suitability is through visual preview and testing in browsers, as mentioned in the lesson - 'your eyes' are the best judge.

questions.question: Images should be previewed before:
questions.explanation: It's always better to preview web pages (including images) before publishing or uploading them to the Internet to ensure they display correctly.

questions.question: In a nested ordered list within an unordered list, the inner list will have:
questions.explanation: When an ordered list is nested within an unordered list, the inner ordered list will still have numbers (or whatever TYPE is specified for OL).
